event.doc_name: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: In early April 2025, the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (“DHS”), through U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (“ICE”), initiated a sweeping and unprecedented wave of Student and Exchange Visitor Information System (“SEVIS”) terminations against hundreds if not thousands of international students with F-1 visas across the country.
evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: Plaintiff Zhuoer Chen is a student of the Master of Architecture program at the University of California, Berkeley and will graduate next month.
evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: Plaintiff Mengcheng Yu is a master’s student in the Educational Technology and Applied Learning Sciences program at Carnegie Mellon University (“CMU”), and currently resides in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. She is set to graduate in August 2025.
evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: Plaintiff Jiarong Ouyang is a doctoral candidate in Statistics at the University of Cincinnati, and lawfully resides in Cincinnati, Ohio, having maintained F-1 student status through his full-time enrollment and academic excellence. Mr. Ouyang seeks to join this action to challenge the unlawful termination of his SEVIS record by the Department of Homeland Security, which has jeopardized his education, his ability to support his family, and his future professional opportunities in the United States.
evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: Plaintiff Gexi Guo is a Chinese national who earned a Master of Science in Applied Analytics from Columbia University in December 2022, and currently resides in New York City under lawful F-1 status. He seeks to join this action to challenge the arbitrary and unlawful termination of his SEVIS record, which jeopardizes his legal status, professional trajectory, and personal commitments in the United States.
evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: In early April 2025, ICE initiated SEVIS terminations against hundreds of international students without notice, explanation, or due process. Affected students include Plaintiffs Zhuoer Chen (UC Berkeley Master of Architecture, graduating May 2025), Mengcheng Yu (CMU Educational Technology, graduating August 2025), Jiarong Ouyang (UC Cincinnati Statistics PhD, GPA 3.94), and Gexi Guo (Columbia Applied Analytics, expunged arrest). Terminations caused immediate harm: abrupt study suspension, housing loss, employment authorization termination, and risk of unlawful presence accumulation.

evidence.text: Plaintiffs bring this action under the APA and the Declaratory Judgment Act to challenge ICE’s illegal termination of their SEVIS records.
evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: Plaintiff Zhuoer Chen will complete her Master of Architecture at UC Berkeley in May 2025. Her academic work centers on sustainable urban development, focusing on the current living conditions of urban wildlife and exploring design-based strategies for their improvement within the field of architecture.
evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: Plaintiff Mengcheng Yu... has no criminal record, not even an arrest.
evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: Plaintiff Mr. Jiarong Ouyang came to the United States in 2012 and earned both a Bachelor of Science in Computing Statistics (2016) and a Master of Science in Applied Statistics (2018) from the University of California, Riverside. He is currently a Ph.D. candidate in Statistics at the University of Cincinnati, where he holds a GPA of 3.94 and is expected to graduate in April 2026.
evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: In January 2019, Mr. Ouyang was arrested for an alleged domestic dispute incident but was never convicted of a crime. The charges were formally dismissed.
evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: Mr. Guo was arrested in May 2024 for an alleged simple assault. The charge was dismissed and fully expunged by court order in August 2024 pursuant to N.J.S.A. § 2C:52-6. The expungement order explicitly directs all law enforcement and government agencies to treat the incident as though it never occurred.
evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs maintained full academic compliance: Chen (sustainable urban development focus), Yu (UNNJ settlement agreement), Ouyang (3.94 GPA, Comer-Reynolds award), Guo (3.8 GPA). Terminations based on expunged arrests (Ouyang dismissed domestic dispute, Guo dismissed simple assault) despite DHS regulations prohibiting such terminations without legal justification.

evidence.text: ICE’s own guidance (Policy Guidance 1004-04) clearly states that visa revocation alone does not justify SEVIS termination. If a visa is revoked after entry, a student may continue their program of study and must simply obtain a new visa prior to re-entry after travel.
evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: Defendants’ termination of Plaintiffs’ SEVIS records constitutes final agency action reviewable under the Administrative Procedure Act, 5 U.S.C. §§ 701–706.
evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: Defendants failed to provide individualized notice, failed to consider relevant facts, and based their actions on impermissible grounds, including visa revocation, which is not a lawful basis for SEVIS termination under 8 C.F.R. § 214.1(d).
evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: Plaintiffs were not provided with any opportunity to respond, clarify their records, or correct misinformation.
evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: ICE terminated SEVIS records without individualized review, violating 8 C.F.R. § 214.1(d) which limits terminations to national security, diplomatic, or public safety reasons. ICE Policy Guidance 1004-04 confirms visa revocation alone does not justify SEVIS termination. Terminations occurred without notice, hearing, or opportunity to contest.

args.reason: All checklist items (Factual_Basis_of_Case) are fully extracted with three comprehensive values supported by evidence from the fully visited Complaint document. No additional evidence from other documents would add distinct factual basis elements per the checklist definition.

All checklist items (Factual_Basis_of_Case) are fully extracted with 3 distinct values supported by evidence from the fully visited Complaint document. No additional documents contain relevant factual basis elements per checklist definition.
